Coronavirus (COVID-19) Information

Learn what precautions you can take about the coronavirus.

Call the KY Department for Public Health’s COVID-19 hotline at (800) 722-5725 or visit its COVID-19 webpage.

More information also is available on KDE’s COVID-19 webpage.

Main Content

Our Vision

Each and every student empowered and equipped to pursue a successful future.

Mission Statement

To partner with districts, schools, families, students, business and industry, and communities to provide leadership and support to ensure success for each and every student.

Our Core Values

The department's core values are equity, achievement, collaboration and integrity.

Relative Content

2020 Search for Kentucky's Next Education Commissioner

On Dec. 12, 2019, the Kentucky Board of Education (KBE) began its search for Kentucky's next commissioner of education. The board hopes to have a new commissioner in place this fall.

Learn More about Commissioner search Link: /comm/Pages/2020-Kentucky-Education-Commissioner-Search-.aspx

Initiatives

Continuous Improvement for GAP closure Link: http://education.ky.gov/school/stratclsgap/Pages/default.aspx

Information, resources, and tools designed to assist schools and districts reduce the number of students scoring at the novice level and improve overall student achievement.

Innovation Link: /school/innov/Pages/default.aspx

“Innovation” is a critical element of the agency’s strategic goals as we strive to make every child college and career ready.

Kentucky Academic Standards Link: https://kystandards.org/

View Kentucky’s Academic Standards in each subject area and resources to support the standards here.

School Report Card Link: https://www.kyschoolreportcard.com/home?year=2019

School and District Report Cards provide detailed information about each school and district, including test performance, teacher qualifications, student safety, awards, parent involvement and much more.

Every Student Succeeds Act (ESSA) Link: http://education.ky.gov/comm/Pages/Every-Student-Succeeds-Act-(ESSA).aspx

The federal education law provides Kentucky more flexibility and allows the state to design a more effective accountability system that encourages improved learning opportunities, achievement and readiness for all students.
